TopicTitle: Devnote Tuesdays: The "Development of 0.25 Has Started" Edition

Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/0ff9377afa68dc3ad3fe6844aaf1bd38/tumblr_inline_n9uz7fiCzK1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><strong>Felipe (HarvesteR)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> Development of 0.25 has started and picking up a good solid pace. The massive clean-up from last week definitely did help there. The project not only compiles faster, but even more importantly, things are much more easy to find and everything seems to have a place (and </span><span>one </span><span>place only). This week, weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve settled the design for the new Administration Facility and weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re starting to develop the UIs and backend systems to support it. WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve got a monumental list of things to do ahead of us though. ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s going to be a huge amount of work, but it feels good to be working on something new again.</span></p>

<p><strong>Alex (aLeXmOrA): </strong><span>Doing some tweaks and setting some changes to the <em>KSP</em> Store website. More information about this soon.</span></p>

<p><strong>Mike (Mu):</strong><span> After last weekÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s monumental cleanup and reorganization, IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been working on some of the core systems for the Administration Facility. The, as yet, secret contents of which are going to provide some interesting dynamics and decisions in career mode.</span></p>

<p><strong>Daniel (danRosas)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> <em>On vacation somewhere with a coastline.</em></span></p>

<p><strong>Jim (Romfarer)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> Last week was spent planning and designing the gui for the Administration Facility and this week i started working on laying out all the components in the unity editor. The planning stage took longer than expected because we decided to scrap the idea we first came up with for a different approachÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ </span></p>

<p><strong>Miguel (Maxmaps): </strong><span>Helped set tasks for the team as far as developing 0.25 goes. Glad to see everyone at full steam. Also got my fingers in some design stuff for the admin building you will learn about at some point in the future.</span></p>

<p><strong>Bob (Calisker):</strong><span> I am going to spend some time this week on GDC speaking submissions, which are due later this month. ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s a very intense process, as I went through it last year and was fortunate enough to be selected to speak. Hopefully, weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll be able to put together some great talks that are considered for the 2015 show too. </span></p>

<p><span>I am also looking forward to sharing something fun that details how quickly the community has taken to Curse.com as our new official mod site later this week. </span></p>

<p><span><strong>Anthony (Rowsdower):</strong> Firstly, IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢d like to welcome <a href="http://bit.ly/1klBQNH"><strong>OverloadUT</strong></a> to the KSP-TV team. YouÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll be able to watch him Monday nights at 11PM EDT. HeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s the first of others youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll be hearing about in due time. IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢d also like to take this time to announce that <a href="http://imgur.com/a/vHy9Y"><strong>Kerb-O-Nautix</strong></a> has officially captured the Kerbin Cup! Their final entry was chosen as the winning one by the dev team. Both they and <a href="http://imgur.com/a/REyGO#90"><strong>Crotchety Old Modders</strong></a> put up a great show. ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s a shame there could only be one final winner, but regardless, a big, hearty congrats go out to Kerb-O-Nautix on this day!<br/></span></p>

<p><strong>Eduardo (Lalo): </strong><span>.<em>Lalo was not available for todayÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s devnotes on account of sudden onset fatherhood.</em></span></p>

<p><strong>Rogelio (Roger):</strong><span> IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m working on 3D in-game assets. For now, IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m just planning on how they will fit with the existing ones. It has been fun to see how everything in the game is modeled and IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m very excited to be working on this stuff. </span></p>

<p><strong>Hugo (Hugol): </strong><span>.Working on improving some pieces. .Went through some designs with Felipe and decided to add a couple new parts too. Other than that, IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve mainly been designing the changes in models and textures.</span></p>

Edited August 6, 2014 by Rowsdower
Sounds interesting, looking forward to those new parts! Also congratulations to Eduardo/Lalo on his sudden onset fatherhood!

More hype...AKA B.S. We're working on exciting stuff, but we can't tell you. It's a secret.

Each week, the devs at Keen Software House deliver a working update of Space Engineers with new features and bug fixes. Each week, Squad delivers hype.

Edited August 6, 2014 by Apollo13
Great. 0.25, something that not in the forecast development plan. And where are the Multiplayer feature been drag to?

More hype...AKA B.S. We're working on exciting stuff, but we can't tell you. It's a secret.

Each week, the devs at Keen Software House deliver a working update of Space Engineers with new features and bug fixes. Each week, Squad delivers hype.

And each week, I play Kerbal Space Program all 7 days and Space Engineers collects digital dust in my Steam library.

More hype...AKA B.S. We're working on exciting stuff, but we can't tell you. It's a secret.

Each week, the devs at Keen Software House deliver a working update of Space Engineers with new features and bug fixes. Each week, Squad delivers hype.

very, very incremental new features. I wonder how KSP would have pulled off releasing contracts or money in a weekly release w/o said releases being hopefully crippled by bugs or balance issues in the intermediate releases.

I'm sure Squad could release a new engine or a new engine every week if they wanted to. Or they have released an even more bare bones set of contracts and added new contracts weekly. Would you be happy about those weekly updates then, even though the amount of actual content you get in the end is pretty much the same?

Weekly updates may be OK if all you're doing is adding 1 or 2 parts which are relatively easy to implement (which is what SE is largely doing). It's much harder to do when you're implementing very large and complex parts of gameplay.

Any news on a public roadmap or has that been nixed for ~:reasons:~?

They were going to do a public roadmap? I don't remember hearing anything about that. Went back to the AMA to see if it was there. Nope. Found a threat in April where they pretty emphatically said they weren't doing a public roadmap, so...yeah

Edited August 6, 2014 by FleetAdmiralJ

They were going to do a public roadmap? I don't remember hearing anything about that. Went back to the AMA to see if it was there. Nope. Found a threat in April where they pretty emphatically said they weren't doing a public roadmap, so...yeah

Just before Maxmaps did the AMA (it came up when he got his promotion), he said that they (as in Squad) would talk about it to decide if it was a good idea. So he didn't commit to doing it, just didn't shoot it down when asked about it. I'd like to see a roadmap, but I can understand why they'd avoid commiting to a public roadmap, given how some parts of the community react to changes in the dev's plans.
